intro: Hieracium nuggaense, commonly known as the Nuggan dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. It features a basal rosette of hairy, lobed leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. Hieracium nuggaense is often found in coastal and inland areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
